title: Drawing, "Apotheosis of a Female Saint", before 1706
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush with blue watercolor, white gouache on blue paper; verso: black and white chalk.
inscribed: Verso in pen and brown ink at lower right: Farelli / various numbers crossed out / D. 6
provenance: Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee by purchase from Giovanni Piancastelli.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Verso contains a study for "Rest on the Flight".

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Apotheosis of a Female Saint", before 1706.
before 1706. Pen and brown ink, brush with blue watercolor, white gouache on blue paper; verso: black and white chalk.. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-7064.
